block.p: An opinionated guide to cultural and recreational goings-on around the state this week. Items may be submitted by mail to On the Towns, Sunday New Jersey Section, The New York Times, 229 West 43d Street, New York, N.Y. 10036; by fax to (212) 556-7219, or by e-mail to njtowns@nytimes.com.

An opinionated guide to cultural and recreational goings-on around the state this week. Items may be submitted by mail to On the Towns, Sunday New Jersey Section, The New York Times, 229 West 43d Street, New York, N.Y. 10036; by fax to (212) 556-7219, or by e-mail to njtowns@nytimes.com.
Museums and Galleries
ARTBUILDERS, INC. Roy M. Luciana, ''Internal Self-Portraits.'' Through Sept. 28. Hours: Fridays through Sundays, 2 to 7 p.m. or by appointment. 193 Montgomery Street, Jersey City. (201)433-2682.
ATLANTI CAPE COMMUNITY COLLEGE Artworks of Faculty and Staff. Through Sept. 29. Call for gallery times. Art Gallery, 5100 Black Horse Pike, May Landing. (609)343-5040.

BERNARDSVILLE PUBLIC LIBRARY Nona Rutter and Debbie Seymour, pastel paintings. Through September 30. Mondays through Thursdays, 10 a.m. to 9 p.m.; Fridays and Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. 1 Anderson Hill Road, Bernardsville. (908)766-0118.
CHAPIN SCHOOL Roxanne Weidele exhibit of drawings, paintings and three-dimensional paper construction. Through Oct. 6 by appointment. Gallery at Chapin, 4101 Princeton Pike, Princeton. (609)924-7206.

GALLERY 214 ''Dreamscapes/Landscapes,'' paintings, prints, photographs and sculptures by 130 artists. Through Oct. 7. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 11 a.m. to 3 p.m.; Saturdays, 1 to 4 p.m. 214 Glenridge Avenue, Montclair. (973)744-8280.

GROUNDS FOR SCULPTURE ''James Dinerstein: New Sculpture,'' works in cast bronze. Saturday through Apr. 8, 2001. Hours: Thursdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Tuesday and Wednesday by appointment. 18 Fairgrounds Road, Hamilton Township. (609)586-0616.

IN RARE FORM GALLERY ''All Chairs: Designs for 2001 and Beyond,'' works by the architect Matthew Hoey. Through Oct. 30. Reception with the artists Thursday, 6:30 to 8:30 p.m. Hours: Thursdays through Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. 14 Church Street, Lambertville. (609)397-1006.

KERYGMA GALLERY ''Paintings,'' one-person show by Frank Trefny. Through Oct. 7. Opening reception: today, 2 p.m. to 5 p.m. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. 38 Oak Street, Ridgewood. (201)444-5510.

MORRIS COUNTY PARKS ''Lenape Indian Ways.'' Today, 1 to 4 p.m. Free. ''Time Line Workshop.'' Saturday, 2 to 4 p.m. Free. Hours: daily, 9 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Great Swamp Outdoor Education Center, 247 Southern Boulevard, Chatham. (973)635-6629.

MORPETH GALLERY Donna M. McCollough, sculpture, and Kate Hammett, paintings. Through next Sunday. Hours: Tuesdays through next Sunday. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. 18 North Main Street, Pennington. (609)737-9313.

CASE MUSEUM OF CONTEMPORARY RUSSIAN ART ''20th Anniversary Exhibit,'' featuring many artists from the inaugural exhibition. Today through Oct. 8. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 2 to 7 p.m. 80 Grand Street, Jersey City. (201)332-5200.
OAKLAND STREET GALLERY ''Perspectives in Color,'' featuring the paintings of Paul Briskey and Norman Perlmutter. Through Oct. 28. Green Apple Studio, 145 Oakland Street, Red Bank. (732)450-2050.

PATERSON MUSEUM ''Up on Two Wheels: A Look Back at Motorcycling in North Jersey,'' show includes antique, classic, military, police, American, Japanese and European models. Through next Sunday. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, 12:30 to 4:30 p.m. 2 Market Street, Paterson. (973)881-3839.
PETERS VALLEY CRAFT EDUCATION CENTER ''30th Annual Craft Fair.'' Saturday, 10 a.m. to 6 p.m. and next Sunday, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. 19 Kuhn Road, Layton, (973)948-5200.

PRINCETON THEOLOGICAL SEMINARY ''Niches,'' works of Thomas McAnulty, sculptor. Tomorrow through Nov. 3. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 8:30 a.m. to 9:30 p.m.; Saturdays, 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.; Sundays, 2 to 9 p.m. Erdman Gallery, (609)497-7990.

PUFFIN CULTURAL FORUM ''Sex, Lies and Politics: Cartoonists Shooting From the Hip,'' current and historic political cartoons. Today through Oct. 29. Opening reception, today at 2 p.m. Hours: Wednesday through Saturday, 1 to 5 p.m.; or by appointment. 20 East Oakdene Avenue, Teaneck. (201)836-8923.
DAVID RAGO AUCTIONS Lalique and Art Glass auction. Saturday at noon. Hours: Today, 2 to 6 p.m.; Monday and Tuesday noon to 4 p.m. 333 North Main Street, Lambertville. (21)297-1048.

SOMERSET ART ASSOCIATION ''Adolf Konrad: A Tribute, Paintings and Drawings, 1970-1995.'' Through Nov. 17. Hours: Monday through Thursday, 9:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.; Fridays, 9:30 a.m. to 2 p.m.; Saturdays, 9:30 a.m. to 1:30 p.m. Johnson Gallery, 2020 Burnt Mills Road, Bedminster. (908)234-2345.

SUMEI MULTIDISCIPLINARY ARTS CENTER ''Cuba: The Illusive Island.'' Through Oct. 14. Hours: Wednesdays, 1 p.m. to 6 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m.; or call for appointment. 19 Liberty Street, at the corner of Lafayette Street, Newark. (973)643-7883.
VICTORIAN SOCIETY OF NORTHERN NEW JERSEY ''American Art Pottery, 1870-1930.'' Fee: $5 for non-members. Montclair Women's Club, 82 Union Street, Montclair. (973)746-2769.

WHIPPANY RAILWAY MUSEUM ''Celebrate the Century Express,'' a U.S. Postal Service-sponsored rolling museum train full of commemorative stamps, video displays and other historical recreation. Saturday, 9 a.m. to 7 p.m.; Next Sunday, noon to 6 p.m. Museum admission: $1 adults; $.50 for children. Route 10 West and Whippany Road, Whippany.
Music
ARTS GUILD OF RAHWAY The Vince di Mura trio plays a tribute to Leonard Berstein. Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $10. 1670 Irving Street, Rahway. (732)381-7511.

THE MANOR ''Broadway and Beyond'' with Tom Anderson. Thursday at 9 p.m., with dinner seatings at 6, 6:15 and 6:30 p.m. Tickets: $69 for dinner and show, $35 for show only. 111 Prospect Avenue, West Orange. (973)731-2369.
MINSTREL COFFEEHOUSE Frank and Hank, and Mark Schaffer and Friends. Friday at 8:30 p.m. Tickets: $5. Morris County Park Commission's Cultural Center, 300 Mendham Road, Morristown. (973)335-9489.
OUTPOST IN THE BURBS Tish Hinojosa. Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $17; $15 in advance. 40 South Fullerton Avenue, Montclair. (973)744-6560.
PRIORY Winard Harper with Carrie Smith. Friday at 7 p.m. No cover. ''AQ Taste of B&B: Ballads & Blues.'' Tickets: $20. St. Joseph's Plaza, 233 West Market Street, Newark. (973)639-7848.
VETERAN'S MEMORIAL PARK Magic Dick and Jay Geils with Bluestime. Friday at 8 p.m. Free. One block north of John Harms Center, between North Van Brunt and Dean Streets. (201)871-6665.

WATCHUNG ARTS CENTER Pam Purvis and Bob Ackerman, saxophonist. Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $10. Silk City, folk trio. Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $10. Watchung Circle, 18 Stirling Road, Watchung. (908)753-0190.
Theater

ATTIC ENSEMBLE ''Fifth of July'' by Lanford Wilson. Opens Friday. Through October 1. Fridays and Saturdays at 8 p.m.; Sundays at 3 p.m. Tickets: $15; $10 for students and older people. Barrow Mansion, 83 Wayne Street, Jersey City. (201)413-9200.
LUMIA THEATER - STAGE II ''Improper Attention,'' by Diane Bairamian. Thursday through next Monday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $12; $10 for stduents and older people. 179 Broadway, Long Branch. (732)229-3166.
NEW JERSEY REPERTORY COMPANY New Play Reading Series presents ''Les Grandes Dames,'' by Nathan Mayer. Tomorrow at 7 p.m. Tickets: $7.50. Lumia Theater, 179 Broadway, Long Branch. (732)229-3166.

TWELVE MILES WEST THEATRE COMPANY ''Shakespeare's R + J,'' adapted by Joe Calarco. Through Sept. 30. Thursdays, Fridays and Saturdays at 8 p.m.; Sundays at 3 p.m. Tickets: $20; $15 for students and older people. (973)746-7181.
TWO RIVER THEATER COMPANY ''Arms and the Man.'' Through Sept. 24. Call for show times. Tickets: $19 to $34. Algonquin Arts Theater, 171 Main Street, Manasquan. (732)345-1400.
WOMEN'S THEATER COMPANY A reading of ''Finding Claire,'' by Kim Merrill. Today at 3. Tickets: $5. (973)443-9125.
FOR CHILDREN
DORBROOK ACTIVITY CENTER ''Fun With French.'' For children 5 to 6 years old. Begins Thursday at 1 p.m., meets weekly through October 26. Fee: $60. Pre-registration is required. (732)842-4000.
HUBER WOODS ENVIRONMENTAL CENTER ''Silly Snake Stories.'' Saturday at 10:30 a.m. Fee: $5 for children; $1 for adults. Pre-registration is required. Brown's Dock Road, Middleton. (732)842-4000.

KELSEY THEATER ''You're a Good Man, Charlie Brown.'' Today at 1 and 4 p.m.; Friday at 7 p.m.; Saturday at 1 and 4 p.m. Tickets: $10 to $12. Mercer County Community College, 1200 Trenton Road, Renton. (609)921-7104584-9444.

PEQUEST TROUT HATCHERY AND NATURAL RESOURCE EDUCATION CENTER ''Spin Casting for Beginners.'' For ages 8 and up. Today at 1 p.m. Free. Pre-registration is required. Route 46 (nine miles west of Hackettstown), Oxford. (908)637-4125.
RITZ THEATER ''The Princess and the Pea.'' Thursday and Friday at 10 a.m.; Saturday at 10 a.m. and 1 p.m. Tickets: $5. 915 White Horse Pike, Oaklyn. (856)858-5230.

SOMERSET COUNTY PARK COMMISSION ''Wanna Be Grossed Out?'' Wednesday, 3:30 p.m. to 5 p.m. ''Sharing Nature With Children.'' Thursday at 10 a.m. ''Sense Impressions.'' Friday at 1 p.m. ''Pictionary.'' Saturday at 7 a.m. For all events, pre-registration is required, call for ticket prices. 190 Lord Stirling Road, Basking Ridge. (908)766-2489.
Spoken Word

BERNARDSVILLE PUBLIC LIBRARY Gretna Wilkinson, poet, meets with teenagers. Tomorrow at 7 p.m. Free. Ilene Beckerman, local author, talks about popular books. Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. 1 Anderson Hill Road, Bernardsville. (908)766-0118.
Etc.
BELLEVILLE PUBLIC LIBRARY Opera Film Class presents the film ''Boris Gudunov,'' 12:30 p.m. Tuesday in the Trustee Room. Free. 221 Washington Avenue, Belleville. (973)450-3434.

CRAFTSMAN FARMS FOUNDATION ''Living the Arts and Crafts Lifestyle V,'' a weekend symposium dedicated to the ideals and influences of Gustav Stickley, with lectures, artisan fair, silent auction, tours of the Stickley family home and more. Saturday, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; next Sunday, 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. Admission: $10 adults, $3 children 6 to 12 for the craft fair; $12 for lectures. 2352 Route 10 West, at Manor Lane, Parsippany. (973)540-1165.

HACKENSACK RIVER FESTIVAL Features canoe and kayak races, food and music, and special presentations by intertribal Indians of New Jersey. Saturday, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Free admission. Laurel Hill Park, Secaucus, (973)367-1679.

MONMOUTH COUNTY PARKS ''Croquet Roquet,'' old-fashioned croquet (with instructions for learners) with cookies and lemonade. Saturday, 10 to 11:30 a.m. Fee: $9, pre-registration required. Historic Walnford in Crosswicks Creek Park, Upper Freehold. (732)842-4000.
At the Casinos
All tickets are available through Ticketmaster, (800)736-1420.

CLARIDGE HOTEL ''Pump Boys and Dinettes,'' national tour of the Broadway musical. Through next Sunday. Mondays through Thursdays at 8 p.m.; Saturdays at 9 p.m.; Sundays at 3 and 7 p.m. Tickets: $15, Sundays through Thursdays; $19, Saturdays. Palace Theater, Boardwalk and Park Place. (609)340-3700.
SANDS HOTEL AND CASINO Michael Feinstein. Friday. Call for times and prices. Indiana Avenue and Brighton Park. (609)441-4137.

TROPICANA Comedy with Robin Montague, Richie Byrne and Basile. Tonight through Thursday at 10 p.m.; Friday and Saturday at 9 p.m. and 11:15 p.m. Tickets: $16 (Sunday through Friday); $18 (Saturday). ''Broadway Tonight Benefit'' with Daphne Rubin-Vega, Andrea McCardle and others. Tomorrow at 8 p.m. Tickets: $25 to $100. Johnny Mathis with Gary Mule Deet. Friday at 9 p.m. and Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $30 to $55. Boardwalk and Brighton Avenue. (609)340-3020.
TRUMP MARINA Michael Franks. Saturday at 9 p.m. in the Shell. Tickets: $35. Huron Avenue and Brigantine Boulevard. (800)777-8477.

TRUMP TAJ MAHAL B.B. King Blues Festival 2000. Tonight at 6 p.m. Tickets: $25, $35 and $45. Mark G. Etess Arena. Dan Fogelberg. Saturday at 9 p.m. Tickets: $27.50 to $37.50. Xanadu. Sarah Brightman. Saturday at 9 p.m. Tickets: $40 to $80. Mark G. Etess Arena. 1000 Boardwalk (609)449-1000.
ON THE TOWNS
